verses.verse: Zedekiah <WH6667> was one <WH259> and twenty <WH6242> years <WH8141> old <WH1121> when he began to reign <WH4427>, and he reigned <WH4427> eleven <WH259> years <WH8141> in Jerusalem <WH3389>. And his mother <WH517>'s name <WH8034> was Hamutal <WH2537> the daughter <WH1323> of Jeremiah <WH3414> of Libnah <WH3841>.
And he did <WH6213> that which was evil <WH7451> in the eyes <WH5869> of the Lord <WH3068>, according to all that Jehoiakim <WH3079> had done <WH6213>.

For through <WH5921> the anger <WH639> of the Lord <WH3068> it came to pass in Jerusalem <WH3389> and Judah <WH3063>, until he had cast them out <WH7993> from his presence <WH6440>, that Zedekiah <WH6667> rebelled <WH4775> against the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894>.

And it came to pass in the ninth <WH8671> year <WH8141> of his reign <WH4427>, in the tenth <WH6224> month <WH2320>, in the tenth <WH6218> day of the month <WH2320>, that Nebuchadrezzar <WH5019> king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> came <WH935>, he and all his army <WH2428>, against Jerusalem <WH3389>, and pitched <WH2583> against it <WH1129>, and built forts <WH1785> against it round about <WH5439>.
So <WH935> the city <WH5892> was besieged <WH4692> unto the eleventh <WH6249> year <WH8141> of king <WH4428> Zedekiah <WH6667>.

And in the fourth <WH7243> month <WH2320>, in the ninth <WH8672> day of the month <WH2320>, the famine <WH7458> was severe <WH2388> in the city <WH5892>, so that there was no bread <WH3899> for the people <WH5971> of the land <WH776>.

Then the city <WH5892> was broken up <WH1234>, and all the men <WH582> of war <WH4421> fled <WH1272>, and went forth <WH3318> out of the city <WH5892> by night <WH3915> by the way <WH1870> of the gate <WH8179> between the two walls <WH2346>, which was by the king <WH4428>'s garden <WH1588>; (now the Chaldeans <WH3778> were by the city <WH5892> round about <WH5439>:) and they went <WH3212> by the way <WH1870> of the plain <WH6160>.

But the army <WH2428> of the Chaldeans <WH3778> pursued <WH7291> after <WH310> the king <WH4428>, and overtook <WH5381> Zedekiah <WH6667> in the plains <WH6160> of Jericho <WH3405>; and all his army <WH2428> was scattered from him <WH6327>.

Then they took <WH8610> the king <WH4428>, and carried him up <WH5927> unto the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> to Riblah <WH7247> in the land <WH776> of Hamath <WH2574>; where he gave <WH1696> judgment upon him <WH4941>.

And the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> killed <WH7819> the sons <WH1121> of Zedekiah <WH6667> before his eyes <WH5869>: he killed <WH7819> also all the princes <WH8269> of Judah <WH3063> in Riblah <WH7247>.

Then he put out <WH5786> the eyes <WH5869> of Zedekiah <WH6667>; and the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> bound <WH631> him in chains <WH5178>, and carried <WH935> him to Babylon <WH894>, and put <WH5414> him in prison <WH1004> until the day <WH3117> of his death <WH4194>.

Now in the fifth <WH2549> month <WH2320>, in the tenth <WH6218> day of the month <WH2320>, which was the nineteenth <WH6240> year <WH8141> of Nebuchadrezzar <WH5019> king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894>, came <WH935> Nebuzar <WH5018>–adan, captain <WH7227> of the guard <WH2876>, which served <WH5975> the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894>, into Jerusalem <WH3389>,

And burned <WH8313> the house <WH1004> of the Lord <WH3068>, and the king <WH4428>'s house <WH1004>; and all the houses <WH1004> of Jerusalem <WH3389>, and all the houses <WH1004> of the great <WH1419> men <WH8313>, burned he with fire <WH784>:
And all the army <WH2428> of the Chaldeans <WH3778>, that were with the captain <WH7227> of the guard <WH2876>, broke down <WH5422> all the walls <WH2346> of Jerusalem <WH3389> round about <WH5439>.

Then Nebuzar <WH5018>–adan the captain <WH7227> of the guard <WH2876> carried away captive <WH1540> certain of the poor <WH1803> of the people <WH5971>, and the residue <WH3499> of the people <WH5971> that remained <WH7604> in the city <WH5892>, and those that fell away <WH5307>, that fell <WH5307> to the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894>, and the rest <WH3499> of the multitude <WH527>.
But Nebuzar <WH5018>–adan the captain <WH7227> of the guard <WH2876> left <WH7604> certain of the poor <WH1803> of the land <WH776> for vinedressers <WH3755> and for husbandmen <WH3009>.

Also the pillars <WH5982> of brass <WH5178> that were in the house <WH1004> of the Lord <WH3068>, and the bases <WH4350>, and the bronze <WH5178> sea <WH3220> that was in the house <WH1004> of the Lord <WH3068>, the Chaldeans <WH3778> broke <WH7665>, and carried <WH5375> all the brass <WH5178> of them to Babylon <WH894>.

The caldrons <WH5518> also <WH3257>, and the shovels, and the snuffers <WH4212>, and the bowls <WH4219>, and the spoons <WH3709>, and all the vessels <WH3627> of brass <WH5178> with which they ministered <WH8334>, took they away <WH3947>.

And the basins <WH5592>, and the firepans <WH4289>, and the bowls <WH4219>, and the caldrons <WH5518>, and the candlesticks <WH4501>, and the spoons <WH3709>, and the cups <WH4518>; that which was of gold <WH2091> in gold <WH2091>, and that which was of silver <WH3701> in silver <WH3701>, took <WH3947> the captain <WH7227> of the guard <WH2876> away <WH3947>.

The two <WH8147> pillars <WH5982>, one <WH259> sea <WH3220>, and twelve <WH8147> bronze <WH5178> bulls <WH1241> that were under the bases <WH4350>, which king <WH4428> Solomon <WH8010> had made <WH6213> in the house <WH1004> of the Lord <WH3068>: the brass <WH5178> of all these vessels <WH3627> was without weight <WH4948>.

And concerning the pillars <WH5982>, the height <WH6967> of one <WH259> pillar <WH5982> was eighteen <WH8083> cubits <WH520>; and a fillet <WH2339> of twelve <WH8147> cubits <WH520> did compass <WH5437> it <WH5672>; and the thickness there was four <WH702> fingers <WH676>: it was hollow <WH5014>.

And a capital <WH3805> of brass <WH5178> was upon it <WH6967>; and the height of one <WH259> capital <WH3805> was five <WH2568> cubits <WH520>, with network <WH7639> and pomegranates <WH7416> upon the capitals <WH3805> round about <WH5439>, all of brass <WH5178>. The second <WH8145> pillar <WH5982> also and the pomegranates were like unto these <WH7416>.
And there were ninety <WH8673> and six <WH8337> pomegranates <WH7416> on a side <WH7307>; and all the pomegranates <WH7416> upon the network <WH7639> were a hundred <WH3967> round about <WH5439>.

And the captain <WH7227> of the guard <WH2876> took <WH3947> Seraiah <WH8304> the chief <WH7218> priest <WH3548>, and Zephaniah <WH6846> the second <WH4932> priest <WH3548>, and the three <WH7969> keepers <WH8104> of the door <WH5592>:

He took <WH3947> also out of the city <WH5892> a <WH259> eunuch <WH5631>, which had the charge <WH6496> of the men <WH582> of war <WH4421>; and seven <WH7651> men <WH582> of them that were near <WH7200> the king <WH4428>'s person <WH6440>, which were found <WH4672> in the city <WH5892>; and the principal <WH8269> scribe <WH5608> of the army <WH6635>, who mustered <WH6633> the people <WH5971> of the land <WH776>; and sixty <WH8346> men <WH376> of the people <WH5971> of the land <WH776>, that were found <WH4672> in the midst <WH8432> of the city <WH5892>.
So Nebuzar <WH5018>–adan the captain <WH7227> of the guard <WH2876> took <WH3947> them <WH3212>, and brought them to the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> to Riblah <WH7247>.

And the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> struck <WH5221> them <WH4191>, and put them to death in Riblah <WH7247> in the land <WH127> of Hamath <WH2574>. Thus Judah <WH3063> was carried away captive <WH1540> out of his own land <WH776>.

This is the people <WH5971> whom Nebuchadrezzar <WH5019> carried away captive <WH1540>: in the seventh <WH7651> year <WH8141> three <WH7969> thousand <WH505> Jews <WH3064> and three <WH7969> and twenty <WH6242>:

In the eighteenth <WH8083> year <WH8141> of Nebuchadrezzar <WH5019> he carried away captive <WH1540> from Jerusalem <WH3389> eight <WH8083> hundred <WH3967> thirty <WH7970> and two <WH8147> persons <WH5315>:

In the three <WH7969> and twentieth <WH6242> year <WH8141> of Nebuchadrezzar <WH5019> Nebuzar <WH5018>–adan the captain <WH7227> of the guard <WH2876> carried away captive <WH1540> of the Jews <WH3064> seven <WH7651> hundred <WH3967> forty <WH705> and five <WH2568> persons <WH5315>: all the persons <WH5315> were four <WH702> thousand <WH505> and six <WH8337> hundred <WH3967>.

And it came to pass in the seven <WH7651> and thirtieth <WH7970> year <WH8141> of the captivity <WH1546> of Jehoiachin <WH3078> king <WH4428> of Judah <WH3063>, in the twelfth <WH8147> month <WH2320>, in the five <WH2568> and twentieth <WH6242> day of the month <WH2320>, that Evil <WH192>–merodach king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894> in the first year <WH8141> of his reign <WH4438> lifted up <WH5375> the head <WH7218> of Jehoiachin <WH3078> king <WH4428> of Judah <WH3063>, and brought him forth <WH3318> out of prison <WH1004>,
And spoke <WH1696> kindly <WH2896> unto him <WH5414>, and set his throne <WH3678> above <WH4605> the throne <WH3678> of the kings <WH4428> that were with him in Babylon <WH894>,
And changed <WH8138> his prison <WH3608> garments <WH899>: and he did continually <WH8548> eat <WH398> bread <WH3899> before <WH6440> him all the days <WH3117> of his life <WH2416>.

And for his diet <WH737>, there was a continual <WH8548> diet <WH737> given <WH5414> him of the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894>, every <WH3117> day <WH3117> a portion <WH1697> until the day <WH3117> of his death <WH4194>, all the days <WH3117> of his life <WH2416>.
